reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First and foremost I must thank everyone and trip advisor for all their inputs and for the website. Now I must do my part. Arrival at Queen Beatrix Airport was smooth. Luggage was acquired and a taxi ($25.00) took us straight to the hotel (approximately 15 min.). Taxi fare is based on location to, and not per person. Each person is allowed one luggage piece and a carry-on. Additional luggage is $2.00 per bag. Also, check to see if you qualify for a free shuttle when booking your trip. Others we met had this free mode of transportation.
reviews.title: A fantasy Island paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course we ended up in the so called dreaded Block "C". Overall it was very nice and a lot of space. Yes there was carpet and tile floors, but it worked out for us. There were two bathrooms, a kitchen area, a living room and a bedroom. The balcony was small (standing room only for two), but it had a great view from the fifth floor. The balcony allowed for viewing the Caribbean, beach and lighthouse in the distance. We also had another view (through other windows) of the beach, as well as some of the best sunsets ever! Overall my wife and I enjoyed our room and felt very comfortable. Also, we didn't have a problem with room security (specifically the safe).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and Beach.. For mostly couples

All meals were different, and there was quite a variety to choose from, also you don't have to worry about a reservation, like at the other a la carte restaurants. Drinks are per glass and no bottle, but you can have as much as you want.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our visit to Aruba. We stayed there for 12 days. The hotel has openend in August 2007. It used to be the Aruba Grand. There are two new buildings A and B and one older building, building C. We read negative comments on the C building, but we did stay in C and the rooms were very spacious and nice. I think the C building is also renovated completely because it looked very new. The only thing is dat the C building has French balconys and A and B have bigger balconys. But because of the hard winds not many people stayded on their balcony. The food in the hotel is excellent, we are not really "buffet" people, but the buffet here is really great. Also the a la carte restaurants are really good, they have more sphere than the buffet restaurant (because it's really big). The beach is great at the Riu, it looks like if there is more space than at the beach with the other hotels. For example the beach at the Marriot is so crowded. The Marriot is very expensive but if you walk at the beach there it looks like Benidorm, it's really busy there! If i could say one thing that's not so good at Riu than i would say the music at the pool. It was far too loud. If you stay at the swimming pool it feels like you're on MTV. But if you stay at the beach you aren't bothered by that. Overall it's a very nice hotel and i would stay there again.
reviews.title: Luxurious new hotel with great food

reviews.title: had a great time at the RIU

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the RIU, great food, great service! The bar staff, pool staff , desk staff and wait staff was quick, friendly and efficient. Our room in the main building was amazing with the most amazing view overlooking the pool and ocean. The room was clean and our baloney was rather large. All inclusive is truly all inclusive at the RIU, mini bar & room service included. Food & drinks were available 24 hrs a day. literaly. The bad elements of our stay was the noise from the elevator and the wind knocking over umbrellas at the pool. The pool area is all sun, so it was a challenge with the umbrellas. This is a very large hotel so if you are looking for somewhere intimate and quaint this is not the place for you. I love a grand lobby and staying on a high floor so it was perfect in that sence for us. The front desk was very helpful making reservation for dinner off the property for us. I would definately recommed the Japanese restaurant on the property - very good! Most amazingly, the hotel was fully staffed at all times, which is remarkable, due to the size of the hotel and number of guests. Not a long wait at the bar or concierge. We would definately would go back to Aruba, and this hotel.
reviews.title: Save Your Money, Try Another Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from Aruba, we stayed at the Riu Palace from April 13-27. This was our honeymoon and we didn't take any shortcuts in terms of room and price etc... we wanted the best and RIU's have a good reputation. We experienced the RIU Bambu in Punta Cana and it was amazing! Great weather, great food and fantastic staff. Our expectations were alot higher for many reasons, Aruba is known to be an amazing island with great food, shopping and most importantly a very safe island. Let me begin with my review...
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the best room available, I believe it is the Suite Oceanview... has a jacuzzi in the room and marble floors and sunken "living room" area. Check in was a breeze, when we arrived to our room 636, new building, we were satisfied with the room. I was kinda expecting more but it was fine. Very big balcony, nice jacuzzi, shower had good pressure, double sinks, king size bed (not 2 queens pushed together), safe, walk in closet, fridge etc... one thing that was forgotten was our honeymoon package included the honeymoon welcome which should of had a bottle of champagne and fruits etc.. nothing. I called the front desk and they assured me that the following day it would be done. No problem.
reviews.title: LOVE Aruba!!

reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Riu Aruba. The hotel is beautiful. The beach & pool were great. Room was 903 in Bldg. A and it was magnificent . Big balcony with 2 lounge chairs overlooking the pool and beach, jacuzzi tub, all marble bath. Only complaint was the bed, very hard. Requested a pad after the 1st night and housekeeper bought an eggcrate type pad and that really helped. Service was great during the entire stay. Check-in and out was a breeze. Food good at the buffet. Ate dinner at the Krystal, Milano & Nautilus. Food and service just ok, actually prefer buffets at breakfast and lunch. Bar service was great. Top shelf alcohol was available if you asked. All in all a great trip and great hotel.

The most important thing for us was the cleanliness. We found the resort very clean. The rooms were cleaned every day. If we ran out of something, we placed the empty container on the bed and when we got back it was taken care of. The one thing we did not like was the way the beds were. We had two full size beds beside each other but they were not hooked together and when you rolled over you could fall throug the crack. The other problem, the walls were not insulated very well and we could hear noise from the room next to us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu in Aruba for our honeymoon (October 11-17, 2009). This was our first trip to the Caribbean and we weren't sure what to expect, but we LOVED it. We didn't have any problems on the direct flight from Charlotte and our arrival at the Beatrix airport was smooth. Make sure to ask your travel agent to give you some form of documentation to get the free DePalms Tours shuttle to the hotel, because ours forgot. We were still able to ride the shuttle (we told them we were on our honeymoon) and all was well. Check-in was painless and we were given a drink immediately upon arrival. We were impressed with our room and with the speedy arrival of our bags. We overslept then spent too long at breakfast the first morning so we missed the dinner reservation timeframe, but were happy to eat at the buffet. My husband really liked all the restaurants and we had lunch most days at the buffet (Don Nicholas) or Nautilus. Everyone was friendly and we met quite a few Americans. When we were there, I can honestly say we only saw three or four children. It seemed to be predominately couples (a lot of honeymooners!). We didn't really venture into the Casino, but the nightly shows were entertaining and the poolside BINGO games were fun. The weather was perfect, which is pretty typical for Aruba, and it only started to storm a little as we were checking out. The only excursion we did was the Pirate Ship snorkeling/rope swing adventure and we loved it! We had a wonderful honeymoon at the Riu and we'd go back in an instant!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon at the Riu!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Except for a few things (lack of in-room wifi, crazy slow elevators, and lounge chair hoarding), we loved the Riu. We’ve stayed at the Hyatt, Renaissance, and the Radisson in years before. These are all so different that you can’t compare them, so I won’t, but the Riu definitely held its own. It is maybe a little less “tropical”, more modern feeling than the others.
reviews.title: Some kinks to work out, but highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Buffets: I liked these. Nobody bothers you to take your room # or anything. Just sport the bracelet and you’re on your own. One or another of the buffets is open almost all day, so you can grab something quick to bring to the beach, and then come back an hour later for a proper breakfast with your people. Very carefree and relaxing to not have to go to a sit-down restaurant for every meal. NO TO-GO COFFEE until 10:30 though, which was a huge miss. I walked to Dunkin Donuts every morning for coffee to take to the ocean.
reviews.title: Perfect Weather, Great Experience, Is it all WORTH IT?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants: Nice change of pace from the buffets, but I would have been fine without them. You must wait in line at the lobby between 9am and noon to reserve for that evening. Each restaurant can only fit about 30 people per sitting, so you have to reserve early to snag a spot. Menus are very limited. No liquor is served – only wine & beer. Rank: Gourmet (good), Japanese (good, except for “sushi”, which was cooked beef (?) and smoked salmon with rice), Steakhouse (ok, not better than the buffet food and worse service I thought), Italian (n/a, didn’t visit based on boring menu).
reviews.title: Super Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Drinks: Everything is poured from open bottles, including wine. So I’m not sure you are getting anything other than boxed wine transferred to bottles. But service at the bars was great… we were always sure to tip though, whereas I gathered most people did not.
reviews.title: Do not pick The Riu for your vacation in Aruba!
